ai-tha-ap142:0.3_0: he gave the Elder Nun to the Fruit of Only Fruits
ai-tha-ap142:1.3_0: I lie down in a mountain cave.
ai-tha-ap142:1.4_0: not far from the Teacher’s head,
ai-tha-ap142:2.1_0: I see a fault in the morning
ai-tha-ap142:2.2_0: in the world with its gods.
ai-tha-ap142:2.3_0: kind is to be abundant in me.
ai-tha-ap142:2.4_0: the poised one, the perfected one;
ai-tha-ap142:3.1_0: for the Fruits of the Earth,
ai-tha-ap142:3.4_0: for the sake of the world’s enjoying the benefit of the world.
ai-tha-ap142:4.2_0: I wandered around on (from the road),
ai-tha-ap142:4.4_0: with the passing away I have died there,
ai-tha-ap142:5.2_0: to which the income is fruitless,
ai-tha-ap142:5.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap142:6.2_0: there are three kinds of blisters:
ai-tha-ap142:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Pippalavaṇṇā.
ai-tha-ap142:9.1_0: for the ten Elder Nun Pippalavaṇṇā
ai-tha-ap142:13.1_0: who gives confidence in those without it,
